1 What this chapter is about
This chapter describes the obligations and liabilities of transporters with respect to the persons they carry
to Canada, stipulated in subsection 148(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA).
Furthermore, it specifies enforcement measures that the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) may
take against transporters who fail to comply with their obligations.
2 Program objectives
The program’s objectives are to ensure that transportation companies fulfil their obligations under
Canada’s IRPA and the operational, procedural and financial liabilities set out in the accompanying
Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR).

Sections A148 to A150 include obligations and liabilities of transportation companies.
Sections R259 to R287 provide procedural rules governing transportation companies.

a travel document issued by Canada to protected persons;

visas referred to in sections R6 and R7 required of foreign nationals to enter Canada;

a permanent resident card; and

an electronic travel authorization (eTA), referred to in section R7.1.
